entry.title: Allegory of Patience (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that contemporary correspondence contributed to the identification of Vasari's Allegory of Patience (pictured)?

entry.title: Malang city council (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2018, 41 out of 45 members of the Malang city council were arrested for corruption?

entry.title: Rhapsody (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Frederick Ashton choreographed the ballet Rhapsody for both Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother's 80th birthday, and Mikhail Baryshnikov's guest appearance with the Royal Ballet?

entry.title: KNCR (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that California radio station KNCR was fined by the Federal Communications Commission for moving its transmitter site without permission after being evicted?

entry.title: rock from New Caledonia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the most significant rock from New Caledonia is peridotite, which comes from the Earth's mantle?

entry.title: Alex Miller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that UMass interim football coach Alex Miller started in all fifty games of his playing career at UMass?

entry.title: Speak Now (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with the album Speak Now, Taylor Swift became the first female musician to have 11 songs on the Billboard Hot 100 in the same week?

entry.title: Fish-MIP (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that models couple up at Fish-MIP?
